I idly suggested doing this yesterday since for March I plan to post one card each day from Suzanne Treisterâ€™s Hexen 1.0 Tarots Deck. 

The deck comprises all the major & minor arcanas depicted by alchemic drawings of people & things from the historical of technology, i.e., the scientific underpinning of what Michel foucault called biopolitical governance. Why? Because I must do some tech related talks this month and also due to the dark side tech being so obvious recently, I needed to think more about it and explore my values / associations etc! 

March 1 â€“ Starting with the Ten of Wands typically representing overload/burden. Here it is represented various early computing projects many subsidized by respective governments. I think of how computers/calculators didnâ€™t exist until jobs became a thing. Even after existing, people still needed to meditate/calculate/punch cards/interpret/etc. And in personal work I still feel like a baby sitter of computr quirks...why canâ€™t spreadsheet software, CMS, database just do this mind numbingly boring & burdensome stuff instead? Also think how, although built on old dull tasks, isnâ€™t exactly the same though? In middle School computer lab

Thread: Indigo's Journey to a New Life

Indigo is embarking on a new chapter in his life. He plans to relocate to Germany and seek a new beginning. This thread aims to provide regular updates throughout his journey.

Last 32 Hours: Horrible! Panicked attack, extreme exhaustion, nausea.

However, look where he is! At the airport! He managed to survive despite the chaos. He describes feeling like he failed himself, but he doesn't believe anything would have turned out differently. He attributes his struggles to attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

He has accomplished a lot during the past three months. He initially believed it would only take him a month, but underestimated every aspect. He re-booked two flights, but faced two deadlines each time, leading to the current situation. He is currently stuck on the 93rd hour.

Meeting with a real estate agent, packing most of the house contents, giving away half of his belongings, gaining access to the remaining items, and arranging for a property owner appointment (POA), among other tasks, shows that he has been very busy recently. He mentions needing a passport, legal documents, and apartment rental confirmation. He also has international certification papers confirming he isn't a criminal.

BHO IN

Another fine evening (ok not really, it's wet and drizzly, but â†’) to continue exploring my stash of #Rum from #Japan
Cor Cor again - this time the "Industrial" (ã‚¢ãƒ³ãƒ‡ãƒ¥ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒªã‚¨ãƒ¼ãƒ«) red version - which is the one they make from the molasses byproduct of sugar making (as opposed to the previous 'green' agricole that's directly from fermenting the cane juice).

Adding to this thread on my #Japanese #Okinawa #Rum exploration
Opened this OneRum bottle intending to daiquiri, but the fragrance or lack prompted me to pull out and get nosy. Smells a bit like Indian palm toddy. Uses sugar just from Ie island. Tempted to say Clairin like but no it's more spirit, vodka or sochu like - thin, smooth with a touch of heat (48%) just a late hint it's sugar distillate. As I mentioned on Boingworld earlier, the estate offered me a garage space where I finally have somewhere to store my van that I can convert into a microcamper. However, upon closer inspection, it turns out that the previous conversion may not have been entirely successful. Specifically, the floor of the vehicle has been lowered, rendering it unsafe to install rear passenger seats. Additionally, the vehicle cannot accommodate a "rock and roll" bed, which converts into seat-belted seating for passengers. Despite these challenges, the vehicle comes equipped with ample under-floor storage space. Even though I've mainly shifted towards PC gaming within the past decade, my favored peripheral equipment remain controllers.
I comprehend the benefits of KB+M gameplay, yet due to my familiarity with these instruments for professional purposes, I perceive acquiring a controller aids in distinguishing between the two activities and provides relief to my wrists. I've also witnessed significant changes in technological advancements and layout utilized throughout the duration of playing video games, although certain initial-party controllers appear stagnant somewhat.
Recently, I discovered a controller that genuinely intrigued me because of its impressively impressive attributes, prompting me to delve further into the subject matter; however, to provide sufficient context, I decided to embark upon a journey through my collection of controllers that accumulated over a lifetime of participating in this hobby.
Ultimately, I hope you'll grasp why this is a subject that interests me greatly, as I dedicate countless hours discussing these devices.

Thread gushing about Game Controllers ğŸ®

Hide post

Even though I've mostly transitioned to PC gaming over the past decade, my preferred peripherals are still controllers.

I understand the advantages of KB+M play, but as someone who already uses those tools for work I find picking up a controller helps separate the two activities and gives my wrists a break. I've also been playing video games long enough to see the technology and layouts used drastically change, though some first-party controllers seem to have stagnated a bit.

I recently found a controller I really liked because it has features that have really impressed me enough to want to talk about it at length, but to do that I feel the need for some context; not a whole history lesson, just a little stroll through my collection of controllers that materialized over a lifetime of engaging in this hobby.

By the end I hope you'll understand why this is a topic I care so much about I'd spend all day talking about these devices.

My decision to build up a PC game collection started during the transition between the Xbox 360 and the Xbox One; I thoroughly enjoyed the 360, but the One was looking like a disaster. Since the new consoles from all three major companies held little interest and I'd been in school for Computer Information Systems, I got myself a 360 PC dongle and resolved to make the switch.

Each of these controllers saw extensive use, and the 360 had the asymmetrical stick placement I preferred. All but two of the controllers in this picture are currently unusable either from loose/drifted sticks, faulty buttons, or failing cables/connections; both of the working ones are third-party Afterglow (which have their own problems).

As much as I loved these controllers, the official ones were the worst in terms of durability, and some were faulty from day one but Microsoft would refuse my RMA request.

It got worse when I tried the most expensive one.

There was a time when I fell for the myth that "you get what you pay for" was as true for expensive things as it was for cheap things; it's because of this controller that I know better. I got this Elite Series 2 controller despite knowing the first iteration had some serious flaws.

That controller lasted just under a year before the stick drift started to set in, and the right bumper only registered half of the time. The cable it came with sucked ass, never worked with any other controllers. The lag from using Bluetooth was so bad the dongle was practically necessary. On top of all that, the back paddles didn't work no matter what software/drivers I used, none of my games ever read those paddles as an inputs.

The Raikiri Pro (was bundled with a laptop) is my current dedicated desktop controller and it works fine [for now], but I will never spend another dime on official Xbox branded controllers. F**k Microsoft, I hope Xbox rots!

The Nintendo Switch reignited my love for portable gaming after years of surviving out of crappy laptops. The Joycon were small but versatile, and the pro controller felt really comfortable in the hands.

I loved these controllers so much I modified them and swapped in Hall-effect sticks [and metal latch] this past year, and while I'm well aware of the drift issue, mine have worked flawlessly since 2017 with no signs of wearing out. I've put just as many hours into these controllers as I did all those Xbox controllers; either I got very lucky or Microsoft designs their controllers to fail faster than both of their competitors combined. Nintendo's offerings have some drawbacks, but the fact it's additional features like gyro input have been officially supported is noteworthy.

I hope to keep these controllers working for as long as they continue to be supported on other platforms; there are many like them, but these ones are mine.

A brief note on PlayStation controllers to round out the firstparty lineup: I never liked them.

DualShock 1-3 felt exactly the same to me with exactly the same flaws: oversized thumbsticks placed too close together, mushy face/shoulder/trigger buttons that seemed to wear out very quickly, and a D-pad that just felt wrong. DualShock 4 fixed a lot of problems, but introduced a bunch of new ones. I got a DualSense because some friends had a hard time with asymmetric thumbsticks, and for some reason local stores were selling them for $20 less than DS4 controllers.

I don't really use this controller: Face buttons are spaced too far apart, my audio in/out defaults to the controller when it's connected, the bumpers are weirdly tall, and I keep accidentally pressing the trackpad when trying to hit menu/share.

They are fine guest controllers that have come a long way in terms of design, but for me they're a novelty at best.

8 BitDo was my first foray into good third-party controllers. This original SN30 Pro (later versions have hall-effect sticks and do not come in the SNES color scheme) remains one of my favorites because holding it is reminiscent of my first console, the SNES.

If I'm having a crappy day and need a nostalgic escape, this is the first controller I reach for. It has all the functionality of a Switch Pro controller, but compacted into a modernized rendition of the SNES controller, complete with concave XY + convex AB buttons, and possibly the best D-pad I've ever used. It's got some minor problems, but it's been a constant source of comfort.

One day the sticks will fail, or the battery will discharge for the last time; but if it means getting one of the modern versions (with hall-effect sticks) and shell swapping them, I'll do it when the time comes.

With such a connection, surely 8 BitDo can't do better than this, right?

Well... 

When I want the familiar comforts of the SN30 Pro but with all the features of a modern controller, the 8 BitDo Pro 2 has been my multiplatform controller of choice.

Everything about this is a functional upgrade from the SN30 Pro: more comfortable grips, hall-effect sticks, analog triggers, programmable back paddles, a physical X/D/S/A mode toggle switch, and a somewhat easily replaceable battery with the option of using AA batteries in a pinch. I also sprang for the carrying case and the mobile phone holster, which doesn't see as much use with a phone (I don't trust its grip that much), but for more compact retro emulators handhelds, it can expand the list of playable games to include ones that need precise analog controls.

There's very few negatives I can say about this controller, but it sits at a close third for favorite controller of my collection. I'll talk about my number 2 pick in a moment, but before that I need to talk about...

How hard is it to find a modernized N64 controller?

There are plenty of cheap N64 imitation controllers, but the three-pronged original was an objectively bad design. I could play N64 games with a modern controller using clever configuration to make the face buttons function as C-buttons, but it's not the same for so many reasons.

I got the RetroFighters Brawler 64 to solve this anachronic conundrum, and it's gone above and beyond my expectations. It was made to mimic the official NSO N64 controller down to the Switch recognizing it as one, with a toggle to make it register as a Pro controller sans right-stick.

It has some problems, but between its layout and compatibility it solves way more problems the official version has. It's perfect for showing someone N64 emulation without the intimidation of the original or the anachronism from finagling a modern controller to work the same.

It's very good at what it's trying to do.

I got this steam controller from a pawn shop after negotiating the price down shortly after the fire sale came to an end on steam. It needed some TLC, and I did what I could to get it up and running again.

It remains one of the most customizable controllers in my collection, with a unique [if questionable] design and features ahead of its time (gyroaim, back paddles, haptic feedback, etc.). It has some problems though; It requires AA batteries, uses micro USB for wired connections, occasionally turns itself back on after being turned off, the back paddles are stiff enough to cause fatigue, the thumbstick cap is necessary since the rubber on it is deteriorating, and it's functionality tends to fluctuate with every update to steam input.

It's more of a unique historical artifact than a regularly used input, but it's a welcome addition and fun to tinker with on rainy days.

It also isn't my number 2 pick, that honor goes to the fact that...

The 8 BitDo Ultimate Bluetooth controller is an almost perfect controller.

Hall-effect sticks, included charging dock that doubles as a port for the included dongle, dedicated 2.4GHz/bluetooth toggle switch, NSPro layout with a much improved D-pad, analog triggers, and programmable back paddles. When I sit down on a couch with this controller, I can swap between a Steam Deck and a Switch faster than the time it takes the TV to switch inputs.

It does have some drawbacks though: It only does X/Switch signals (no Android or Apple modes), the triggers are uncomfortable, and input lag seems to be affected by the time it took to connect to the dongle/switch.

I thought this was the best it could get, but like my time with Xbox controllers I was operating on assumptions that started to sound like old brand loyalty reflexes coming back. What I'd hoped to upgrade it to was such a disappointment it swiftly shook me from those assumptions.

Translation:

Thread discussing various types of game controllers, including the pros and cons of different options available today.

Thread: Indigo's Journey to a New Life

Indigo is embarking on a new chapter in his life. He plans to relocate to Germany and seek a new beginning. This thread aims to provide regular updates throughout his journey.

Last 32 Hours: Horrible! Panicked attack, extreme exhaustion, nausea.

However, look where he is! At the airport! He managed to make it despite the chaos. He describes feeling overwhelmed and exhausted during the trip. Despite the difficulties, he persevered and arrived safely.

He pushed himself beyond his limits and ended up unable to sleep for three days straight. As of now, he is currently in his 33nd hour. Looking back on this experience, he realizes that it wasn't meant to happen in such a manner. He attributes this to his attention deficit disorder (ADHD).

In summary, Indigo has faced numerous challenges during his journey, including panic attacks, extreme exhaustion and nausea. However, he has successfully navigated through each obstacle and reached his destination.

As I mentioned on Boing.com several months ago, the estate offered to give me a garage space where I could eventually put a van I wanted to convert into a Micro Camper. 

Therefore, I purchased this Berlingoo van last month. 
I assumed that because it was already transformed into a van, it might make the conversion process simpler. However, turns out that isnâ€™t necessarily true. In other words, itâ€™s been converted specifically for a wheelchair lift, which means that the floor has already been lowered, making it impossible to install rear passenger seats safely. Additionally, it cannot have a â€œrock and rollâ€ bed, which converts into seat-belted seating for passengers. There is indeed a large under-floor storage area added to the vehicle however.

I initially thought removing the metal plates covering the windows would be relatively simple, but it ended up being a mistake since these were simply painted over with metallic paint instead of actual metal plates. Fortunately, scraping away the paint should suffice, possibly using some solvent-based paints dissolved before applying new ones. I left the experts to take care of that part.

However, the people who can effectively convert it into a Micro Campers are currently occupied till mid-July, leaving me with limited time to complete the project myself.

The source text is already translated into Estonian. Here is the translation:

Game 9 of #Universality Challenge was a terrible match. Oxford University (530 students) versus Durham (20,000), and Oxford won, which surprised me after some mistakes they made. The captain didn't know Wittengstein's name? Possibly just nervousness. Durham was ahead, then it was tied at 170, then they dropped to 165. A pity. I was rooting for them. Great team, with all four strong, so I hope they make the cut.

Game 10 of #Universality Challenge had a great performance by Christ's Cambridge, who has a consultative captain, a good team, and a strong member named Bethlehem, so Roger Tilling called out "Christ's Bethlehem!". Exeter Oxford never got hold of much, and are out of the running. I can see Christ's Cambridge quietly going far in this series. 

Some nice math problems, a picture round related to food, and a tricky flag question. Good game.

Game 11 of #Universality Challenge was St Andrews (granted university status by an antipope!) versus Cardiff. The first round is near completion. Some good questions, including references to roll-on roll-off ferries, Agnes Martin, and Stax Records. Cardiff Tarsala will never forget her Booker T bloomer, I'm afraid. Nice quizbing from both teams, though it only really gets crackin' in the last few minutes.

Game 12 of #Universality Challenge was Leeds versus Edinburgh. Leeds takes a long time to get going, then has a surge in the middle but cannot maintain it. Seems like a lot of film questions this time, and I am glad to hear PEI as an answer; no flags, though it seems like they crop up every time. Edinburgh Myles is a good captain and the entire team is strong and works well together. I think they'll do well.

#Universality Challenge Game 13 was a peculiar one, with Leicester being jocularly wasting time and never getting going, while the LSE captain would often turn to the furthest player for an answer, which was not frequently wrong. Still, LSE cleans up. I liked the blues bonus round, though sadly Leicester got none. Canadian mentions: WL Mackenzie King and Margaret Atwood. The best part was Roger Tilling saying "Leicester Lister!"

Game 14 of #Universality Challenge was top-notch stuff, solid quizbing, down to business, fast answers, good knowledge, close ending. It seems we'll see both SOAS London and St. Edmund Hall Oxford again, because the loser makes the repechage. Very close at the finish, down to "Naples" and "pollen". An unassumingly great game.

Game 15 of #Universality Challenge is the first of two in the repechage, where the four highest scoring losing teams try to make it through. This week was UCL and St. Andrews, in a friendly match. Very strong play from UCL, who have a solid team, and UCL Mandel was in top form. Good questions, some tough ones, such as needing "panthera" specifically or knowing "day" in Russian.

Just got to game 16 of #Universality Challenge today, a week late, and it was a nail-biter! Really fast work at the end, with Durham coming from behind in the last few minutes to catch SOAS London in a tie in the final seconds. It went to a starter question that I got on the first clue (being an SF reader I knew "slipstream") but neither team knew. Second question and SOAS London Lambert guessed alpaca but it was llama, so Durham wins. Pheh, what a finish. ğŸ˜±

Game 17 of #Universality Challenge is the first of eight knockouts in the second round. This was UCL and LSE, and UCL gave an outstanding performance: very fast buzzing, good teamwork, wide general knowledge from them all (UCL Mandel notable again); they take off at the start and never slow. Very impressive.

Game 18 of #Universality Challenge was Durham versus Open University. I was rooting for Durham, who have a great team, but in the end to my surprise Open took it, after a number of rather slow answers. I was glad Durham got Marcel Duchamp right on one question; too bad no one knows Yoko Ono as a Fluxus artist. Much respect for Durham Nash, especially on bird silhouettes and flags.

Game 19 of #Universality Challenge was Exeter versus Bristol. Bristol got going at the start and never looked back, rolling with momentum, finishing with an incredible score. Exeter only clawed their way back to 0 after 17 minutes. I liked the question on common terms in Chinese place names, such as åŒ— (beijing) in Beijing etc. Good geographic knowledge shown.

#Universality Challenge is back from the Christmas alumni series, and game 20 was liked greased lightning compared to previous rounds. Darwin Cambridge Whitaker tore into questions like a monster, but everyone was in good form on that team and also on Edinburgh. Momentum changes throughout the game. Good quizbing. Three more games in Round Two, then the long quarter finals.

It's quite a change to go from the Christmas series of #Universality Challenge, where four people did not know the name of the narrator of Moby Dick even when told his name is in the first sentence of the book, to the regular round, where they're racing to buzz on questions like "fifty-three british thermal units is to grouse hunting as sydney australia is to what famous star of the london stage?"

The translated text reads:

"Just fell down a Doritos rabbit hole

He heading down to CVS pharmacy to pick my wife up some tissues (medicated due to sickness). So I'm hungry after my workday of looking at computer screens and I pass the snack aisle and my attention is pulled to a little bag on the shelf that is Doritos. But of course it isn't regular Doritos but rather the bag is all black with a neon sort of aesthetic to it and the Dorito bag prominently displays the words DORITOS: LATE NIGHT. Of course underneath the subflavour is "Loaded Taco".

So of course I pick it up and I eat it and it tastes like the Taco Bell beef seasoning mixed with Nacho Cheese with that little hint of somehow synthesized Taco Bell lettuce and it tastes spot-on, big props to the Dorito scientists who are in Hell, but I continue to be plagued by the concept of Doritos Late Night Line Flavors. Flavors that are representative of late-night. I begin to think: What other late-night flavors are possible? Several beers flavors? Indica Nightmare?

It was then that the immortal words of Mao resonated through my Loaded Taco Skull to go investigating instead of fantasizing about Difficult Conversation Doritos so I went and tried to track down Doritos Late Night Line. 500 food products were released to the US public every year and about 480 of them disappeared within six months and PepsiCo knows this which is why they don't do any marketing or advertising-blind drops at the corner, secret boxes where the arrival is the announcement.There's very little what I managed to collate is this: There are three other flavors of late night Doritos: Sizzling Cheeseburger (?), Last Call Jalapeno Poppers (?) and "Chili Sandwich," which is not a flavor However, in my attempts to find out anything about the Doritos Late Night Line, I stumbled upon DORITOS AFTER DARK AT THE CRYPTO.COM STADIUM, the official Doritos Concept Restaurant. Thinking that the marketing may be a near miss, I nearly closed the tab but for spotting LATE NIGHT in copyright font.

What I have concluded is as follows:
- Doritos After Dark, which is not a chips brothel, has nearly nothing to do with Doritos Late Night, despite both being named the same thing and having near identical branding.I assume this is something like when your older brother gave you a shirt with his name monogrammed on the lapel
- Everybody responsible for Doritos After Dark is going to be in heavy Hell

We don't necessarily need an ersatz munch squad about this-we live in America, the average manhole leads to the Garden of Earthly Delights original Mario Bros movie style, so why should the Staples Center be necessarily different. It's, like, fair food, no worse than fried Oreos Even so, there is something perhaps post-farian about the Ramen-Rito, a burrito where the primary carbohydrate substrate is cooked ramen, and which advertises "Fresh Scallions". Uh, Yeah, I sure hope it does.

To dine here is to reap the wine-dark benefits of being a ticketholder at the Crypto.com Stadium, home of the fucking Lakers-the price of a ticket is counted in teeth-so yes. "Kick it up a notch." "Taste a bold new act." Wh-why is that Doritos bag so airbrushed? It's giving Adam Sandler click. But I'm nitpicking here.It's your The Lakers, you choose the food.Nah.

You know that picture of the guy with the shirt that says 0 fears and then Bart Simpson porn is banned so it says 1 fear? It's similar to that except now I am afraid to eat the home-cooked food of anyone I do not know intimately because there is a slim yet extant chance that I might sit down to a delicious home-cooked normal dinner to eat with them in their house and similarly to Judas at the famous dinner they might kiss my cheek good-like then serve me up "Cool Ranch Biscuits With Honey Butter"

Like there is undoubtedly, because the world is so so so sosososoo big and we are so small one person per person and information is so big and free, somebody who has made this, and then served it to someone who does not have the same brain as them.Homecooked food is meant to be eaten Like it's a social problem now, sitting down in your breakfast nook, or your table, and your wife brings in a charcuterie board, like this, and you have to eat it Or it's bad for you Like as a person.

There's a lot of things that are wrong with America.This doesn't clock the 15th percentile. It's just an average sort of excess, another straw on the like last descendant of the great plains buffalo's ailing back.Even so, even being as jaded to the way that Americans eat as I am, having ordered a one-scoop cup of Superman Flavor Ice Cream last night, I find that I have not and could never reach rockbottom.There is a 121st day of sodommy, my uncle who works at Nintendo told me about it.

Thread: Indigo's journey to a new life! A thread
Note: all major updates will start with the thread emoji
Indigo is attempting to move to Germany and find a new life! Follow this thread to follow this journey
The last 32 hours or so were HORRIBLE! Panic attack, extreme fatigue, nausea.
But! Look at where I am! The airport!! I fucking did it!
I pushed myself too hard and ended up not sleeping for 32 hours. As of right now (write now) I am on the 33rd hour :p. Looking back, this is the way, and it wouldnt have happened any other way. ADHD is a Tanzanian to tame.
Edit: tazmanian.
In the past three months, I have done so much! I thought it would only take me a month, but I seriously underestimated everything. I rebooked the flight twice, but with two deadlines, this plane is it!
Oh gosh.. I met with a real estate agent, packed (most) of the house, gave a third of my stuff away, the appropriate people have access to the rest, and my sister can be a POA should need be. Seven or so documents apostilled, degree recognized in Germany, language courses booked, potentially a scam apartment rental reserved, vital documents confirmed! I also have an international certificate proving I am not a criminal! IT'S GO TIME!

Officially in Germany! Got my visa, new SIM card in Spain, and waiting for the train to Cologne.
Gotta be honest. I screwed myself with bags. Too heavy for this small trans girl ğŸ˜„. Navigating where to get my luggage was fun! Turns out connections via train from plane aren't elsewhere. I'm usually very organized, but it's a bit of stress. But only because as-is stands right now, I don't have support systems. I don't know this city. Have heavy luggage. Etc.
I have never been more thirsty in my life!
PS: I have a story from the plane that isn't appropriate for family. And that doesn't involve me.
Booked a hotel (yes, yes.. late on that.. But I should have an appointment tomorrow.)
First impressions of Germany: architecture, even of the steel and glass of the train station, does not disappoint! Germanic design totally didn't play any role in my choice of destinations ğŸ˜.

Okay, the first German words to learn will have to be train and transit-related terms. Future Indi, make a note!
Seattle and San Francisco are the best public transportation options in America [citation needed], and once you figure it out, it really is zip Zap Zoom on and off and you're there! I want to get to that, but even living in Seattle it took me several months.

Thread: Note: Do not get on the opposite end of the train when carrying three bags!

I am that clumsy American today ğŸ›’ğŸ˜

Sure hope lactose intolerance is easily accessible in Germany, otherwise I'm in trouble ğŸ˜†. Nom nom nom ğŸ¯

Thread: Keys! Sweat, hot, and I had to endure an ordeal getting the keys from a creepy old man neighbor building landlord who was totally hitting on me. Ugh. Sometimes it sucks being cute. Do I pass or something?! Or does he not care? XD
I meet my landlord on Monday for anmeldung registration papers, mailbox name, contract (which I asked for), etc. I've been told having the keys bestows tenant rights protections so we're good. Apartment rental for 3 months though! Let's gooo
Edit: Reposted with keys erased

For those wondering, I still have my hotel room. I played it safe and didn't want to rely on being able to get keys yesterday with luggage in tow

Thread: Netflix has joined the list alongside eBay, Amazon, and Zelle in deactivating/locking my accounts due to suspicious activity. And among the greater list of systems putting me in what we'd call "the bad flow". At work.

Thread: Free network funk denied me three times, but the fourth went through. Finally received their SIM card. Expatio finally accepted my valid proof of residence after declining it the first time (my literal proof of anmeldung, which they state is valid)... and unlocked my account last week. And the money that went into the void? It turned up. So not all things are perilously bad, but I am literally swimming upstream against a system hell-bent on making my life as difficult as possible.

Thread: Here is where I could talk about systemic oppression being literal digital systems, and how these issues won't happen to someone who comes over on a job transfer. But I came over the hard way, unregistered, and flagged one system which I'm sure triggered the next and the next. It all started around when I stopped doing tourist stuff: P.S. A victory, buying laundry tokens from the Hausmeister! I memorized a few words and shit bricks when I WhatsApp'd him and he called me immediately on the phone xD.

As I mentioned earlier on Boing World, the estate provided me with a garage space where I eventually found a suitable vehicle to transform into a microvan. 

Therefore, I purchased a Berlingo van last month. Initially, I believed that since it was originally designed as a van, it might be easier to convert into a camper. However, upon closer inspection, it turns out that the conversion process may not be straightforward due to various factors such as the presence of a wheelchair ramp and the necessity to secure rear passenger seats safely while maintaining the necessary safety standards.

Despite these challenges, the Berlingo offers ample storage options beneath the floor level, making it a practical choice for a camper conversion project. Additionally, the under-floor storage provides additional flexibility during travel.

However, removing the metal plate covering the windows proved to be a mistake initially. Upon further investigation, it became apparent that the metal plates were simply painted over with metallic paint rather than actual metal pieces. Fortunately, scraping away the paint allowed us to proceed with the removal of the metal plates.

Hello! I am interested in discussing the topic of technology and its impact on society. Specifically, I am curious about the role of artificial intelligence and quantum computers in shaping modern society. Could you provide some insights on this topic?

Even though I've mainly shifted towards PC gaming within the past decade, my favored peripheral equipment remain controllers.
I comprehend the benefits of KB+M gameplay, yet given that I utilize similar tools for work, I perceive acquiring a controller aids in separating the two tasks and provides relief to my wrists. I've also witnessed significant changes in video game technologies and layouts over time, although certain initial-party controllers appear stagnant somewhat.
Recently, I discovered a controller that genuinely intrigued me due to its impressively impressive attributes, necessitating lengthy discussion, however, I feel the necessity for contextual information; not a comprehensive history lesson, merely a short walk through my collection of controllers that accumulated throughout my engagement in this hobby.
Ultimately, I hope you'll grasp why this subject matters greatly to me, as I dedicate countless hours discussing these devices.

Teks yang digunakan pada Nokia 2110 ini tidak memungkinkan pengguna untuk mengetik semua huruf dalam alfabet mereka. Ini membuat banyak orang merasa frustrasi karena hanya bisa mengirim pesan dengan menggunakan tiga atau empat karakter di setiap tombol. Namun, ada satu keuntungan besar dari hal ini adalah bahwa "O" dan "Z" memiliki kunci sendiri, sehingga Anda dapat mencoba untuk menambahkan lebih banyak kata kerja jika ingin melakukan itu.

Dalam konteks lain, Nokia 2110 juga tidak menerima semua huruf dalam alfabet Anda, termasuk "oqz". Namun, "1" masih kosong meskipun demikian.

SMS penerbitan teks ini pertama kali diterapkan pada Nokia 2110, seharusnya kami memiliki beberapa alasan untuk menjadikan ini sebagai fitur standar pada telefon kita saat ini. Misalnya, bagaimana saya mendapatkan nomor telepon saya? Dengan cara ini, saya akan dapat berkomunikasi dengan teman-temanku tanpa harus meluangkan waktu untuk menghubungi operator telepon.

Namun, bahaya terbesarnya adalah bahwa "0" selalu menjadi simbol kosong. Bagaimana saya bisa menggunakan "0"? Apakah dia benar-benar simbol kosong? Dan apakah "1" dimaksudkan sebagai simbol kosong? 

Pada akhirnya, belajarlah bahwa "0" adalah simbol kosong, tetapi "1" bukan. Jadi, apa maksud "1" di sini? Mungkin saja, ini adalah simbol kosong yang ditentukan oleh sistem operasi tersebut.

Selain itu, "+1" adalah kode yang biasanya digunakan untuk menyebutkan jumlah anggota suatu kelompok. Di Amerika Serikat, "+1" sering digunakan untuk menyebutkan jumlah anggota suatu grup sosial atau komunitas tertentu. Oleh karena itu, "+1" sangat penting bagi penyebaran informasi dan hubungan antara individu.

Akhirnya, "Q" adalah salah satu simbol yang paling populer dalam bahasa Inggris. Sebagai contoh, nama negara seperti New York berasal dari "Y", yang merupakan simbol "Q".

Sebelum kita berjalan jauh lagi tentang T9, pastikan Anda telah membaca artikel ini secara keseluruhan agar Anda dapat memahami konsep dasar dari sistem ini. Selamat membaca!

Berikut adalah cerita singkat dan menyenangkan yang mengajarkan apa yang tidak boleh dilakukan, khususnya jika Anda merasa seperti [merujuk pada profil Jim Grandone] sebagai seorang politisi kampanye lama. Hanya partai demokratik[.] Profesional media publik[.] Menikah dan menikmati hidup di negara bagian Washington[.] Selanjutnya hingga tahun 2026

Setiap kali saya berdoa dengan kebenaran, apabila Anda sedang mempersiapkan perjalanan ke Amerika Serikat dalam beberapa bulan atau tahun depan, jangan pergi ke Amerika Serikat. Sebagai semua orang. 

Anda akan tidak terlindungi sini. Ini adalah sebuah negara fascis dan politikannya saat ini adalah untuk memberikan penjara kepada orang-orang karena kesalahan seksual mereka.

Saya tidak bisa secara langsung melaporkan tentang kedudukan Jim Grandone, tetapi Jika dia benar-benar seperti profesi profesional mediasi publisinya yang diketahui dari profilnya, dan jika pemilikannya masih melemparkan poin bahwa "SEMPAT DENGAN RISIKO", itu diterima oleh SEJUMLAH orang dalam Partai Demokrasi, seperti hal tersebut hanya merupakan "satu masalah yang lebih baik daripada lainnya". - dan "biasanya dapat dicapai melalui bisnis biasa".

Ini bukan olahraga. Ini adalah sesuatu yang sangat penting bagi kita semua. Dan setiap individu yang tidak ada di Amerika Serikat saat ini harus mempertimbangkan Amerika Serikat sebagai zona isolasi. Hal yang paling aman yang anda bisa lakukan atas dasar Amerika Serikat.

Sebuah hal yang pasti saya katakan dengan pewarnaan absolut adalah bahwa siapa pun anggota parpol politik yang masih membawa gerhana matamu "Aku masih percaya pada kebaikan fundamental manusia Amerika" adalah orang yang mungkin begitu sulit atau lemah fisik dan Anda perlu melakukan APAPUN yang tidak sama dengan pendapat tersebut. Mereka teori telah mendapatkan tes komprehensif pada tahun lalu dan hasilnya adalah bahwa itu hanya sebuah kalimat yang bercampur cairan darah dan akhirnya mati.

Bisa percaya pada kebaikan fundamental manusia Amerika, tentu saja, tapi tentang "MANUSIA AMERIKA" menjadi "BAHAYA"? Ya, data cukup sepenuhnya menentang itu.

Terjemahan:

Saya telah mengatakan beberapa bulan lalu di Boing World bahwa properti memberikan saya sebuah gudang yang berarti akhirnya ada tempat untuk memasukkan mobil yang dapat ditukar menjadi campervan kecil. Jadi aku membeli mobil Berlingo pada bulan ini. Saya yakin fakta itu sudah dikonversi menjadi mobil mungkin membuat proses konversinya lebih mudah. Namun hasilnya bukan seperti apa yang diperkirakan sebelumnya. Ini kemarin dibuat sebagai ramp kursi roda khusus, sehingga permukaannya telah dipindahkan dan hal tersebut menyebabkan tidak adanya ruang aman untuk menempelkan kursi belakang penumpang setelah penggunaan, serta tidak bisa memiliki sisi "rocker n' roller" yang dapat disambungkan dengan kursi belt yang dapat membantu pasien dalam kondisinya. Meskipun demikian, ia masih memiliki ruangan penyimpanan besar bawah. Saya juga yakin akan cukup mudah untuk menghapus plat besi atas papan pintu, tetapi hasilnya adalah kesalahan harfiah. Tidak ada plat besi. Mereka hanya melapisi papan dengan cat besi. Terima kasih kepada profesional untuk melakukan tugas-tugas tersebut.

Saya sekarang akan mengunggah kartu yang saya buat dari kertas tarot suzanne treister untuk bulan maret. Kertas ini terdiri atas semua elemen penting dan menengah dalam tarot, seperti alchemy, teknologi, dan biopolis politik. Saya membuatnya karena ingin berfokus pada konsep teknologi dan bagaimana kita mempengaruhi kehidupannya melalui penggunaan teknologi tersebut.

Saya memilih perangkat keras untuk bermain game karena saya telah mengalami transisi dari konsole Xbox ke Xbox One selama beberapa dekade sebelumnya. Saya sangat menyukai kontrol remoter yang dikenakan pada konsol ini dan merasa lebih nyaman saat menggunakan mereka daripada kontrol remoter lainnya. Namun, ada beberapa contoh kontrol remoter yang tidak terlalu baik atau tidak sesuai dengan preferensi saya. Misalnya, kontrol remoter yang dijual secara massal oleh Microsoft adalah salah satu contohnya. Selain itu, kontrol remoter yang dijual secara massal juga memiliki banyak masalah seperti stik kontrol yang bocor atau tombol kontrol yang rusak. Kontrol remoter yang dijual secara massal juga sering kali memiliki konektivitas yang buram atau tidak stabil. Oleh karena itu, saya menyarankan agar Anda mencari kontrol remoter yang berkualitas tinggi dan mendapatkan dukungan teknis yang kuat jika mungkin.

Saya tiba di sebuah lubang keraun dari Doritos dan saya membeli beberapa bahan untuk mengobati sakit kepala yang diajukan oleh ibunya karena keadaan penyakitnya. Setelah berjam-jam melihat layar komputer dalam pekerjaanku sehari, saya terperanjat dengan minuman Pepsi Universum hingga akhirnya menemui sebuah tas doritos hitam yang tampak sangat unik dan memiliki desain yang elegan. Namun, tidak seperti doritos biasa, ini adalah doritos hitam dengan warna hitam yang menyatu dengan warna neon dan mencerminkan pesanan "Doritos: Late Night" pada dasarnya. Mereka juga memberikan penambahan "Sub Flavor" bernama "Loaded Taco".

Setelah membuka tas tersebut, saya mulai merasa puas setelah mendapatkan rasa doritos yang mirip dengan rasa steak Doritos, namun ditambahkan dengan ciri-ciri yang membuatnya lebih sedikit sama sekali dengan rasa steak. Ini bukannya mereplika rasa steak, tetapi merupakan rencana baru tentang apa bisa menjadi rasa steak lainnya.

Sebagai hasil dari pengalaman itu, saya mulai bertanya-tanya apakah ada lagi jenis doritos lainnya yang dapat disebut sebagai "doritos late-night". Sebelum saya berkembang pikir, saya melihat sebuah nama baru yang muncul di Twitter, "Doritos After Dark," yang dikenakan oleh Pepsico. Mengingat bahwa mereka selalu melakukan drop produk tanpa promosi atau kampanye, saya kemudian mencari informasi lebih lanjut tentang "Doritos After Dark."

Namun, saat saya mencoba mencari informasi lebih lanjut tentang "Doritos After Dark," saya menemukan bahwa mereka tidak hanya menjual produk doritos, tapi juga memiliki restoran doritos sendiri yang bernama "Doritos After Dark Stadium." Menurut saya, hal ini mungkin saja adalah kesempatan yang baik untuk mengeksplorasi dunia doritos, meskipun ia tidak secara langsung berhubungan dengan doritos late-night.

Akhirnya, saya menemukan bahwa doritos After Dark tidak memiliki hubungan apa pun dengan doritos late-night, bahkan jika kedua-duanya menggunakan istilah yang serupa dan memiliki branding yang sangat similitrak. Jadi, saya mengira ini mungkin adalah sesuatu yang seperti ketika temanmu memberikan kaos dengan nama monogram Anda pada lapel.

Mengingat bahwa kami hidup di Amerika Serikat, mana yang lebih besar darinya, adalah siapa yang akan datang pertama kali kepada tempat-tempat makanan tradisional kita. Oleh karena itu, makanan yang dimiliki oleh doritos After Dark tidaklah lebih buruk dibandingkan dengan gorengan oreo. Meski demikian, ada sesuatu yang mungkin kurang populer tentang ramen-rito, yang adalah burrito yang digunakan sebagai karbonhidrat utama yang dikonsumsi adalah mie ramen. Dan mereka menawarkan "scallion fresh". Oh ya, pastikan untuk meminimalkan jumlah makanan yang kamu konsumsi.

Untuk makan di sini, kamu harus menjadi anggota tim tiket pembelian di stadion Crypto.com, tempat laga basket Los Angeles Lakers berlangsung. Biarpun harga tiket Lakers cukup mahal, tapi biarpun begitu, Lakers adalah tim basket yang paling hebat di NBA, sehingga harga tiketnya dipertimbangkan dalam gigi. Jadi, "Kamu boleh naik satu pangkat." "Cicipi makanan baru." Tidak, tidak, tidak! Karena doritos bagus!

Jangan sampai anda menulis kata-kata ini.

The speaker fell into a Doritos rabbit hole while trying to pick up tissues for their sick wife. They passed the snack aisle and were drawn towards a bag of Doritos, which was black with a neon aesthetic and featured the words "Doritos: Late Night" along with its sub-flavors. They continued to ponder over the possibility of other late-night flavors before deciding to investigate the Doritos After Dark concept restaurant located at the Crypto.com Stadium. Despite the lack of marketing efforts, they managed to gather information about the Doritos After Dark concept, including the fact that it had nothing to do with the Doritos Late Night line. They also mentioned that the Ramen-Rito, a burrito with cooked ramen as the main carbohydrate source, advertised "Fresh Scallions," which they found amusingly airbrushed. Finally, they expressed their disappointment with the quality of the food offered at the Doritos After Dark restaurant compared to the home-cooked meals they typically enjoy during breaks.

I fell into a Doritos Rabbit Hole while eating a bag of Doritos. I went to CVS Pharmacy to get my wife some tissues because she was sick from her workday staring at a computer screen. As I passed the snack aisle, my attention was drawn to a Pepsi Universe soda bottle featuring a black Doritos bag with a neon aesthetic. The Doritos bag prominently displayed the words "Doritos: Late Night" along with a sub-flavor called "Loaded Taco."

After picking up the Doritos bag, I ate it and found its taste to be reminiscent of the taco bell Beef Seasoning mixed with Nacho Cheese, with a slight hint of some unknown combination of taco bell lettuce. The Dorito scientists were in heaven, but I continued to struggle with the idea of the Doritos Late Night Line. I began to wonder if there were other late-night flavors available besides those represented by the DoritosLateNight brand. 

The immortal words of Mao resonated through my loaded tacos skull, urging me to investigate instead of daydreaming about difficult conversations. I decided to track down the Doritos late night lineup at the Crypto.com Stadium, the official Doritos Concept Restaurant. Thread: Indigo's Journey to a New Life

Indigo is embarking on a new chapter in his life. He plans to relocate to Germany and seek a new beginning. This thread aims to provide regular updates throughout his journey.

Last night, he spent 32 consecutive hours in a panic attack, accompanied by extreme fatigue and nausea. However, looking back, he realizes that this situation would not have occurred otherwise. He attributes this experience to his attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

He has accomplished a significant amount during the past three months. He initially believed it would only take him a single month, but underestimated every aspect of the process. He re-booked two flights, but faced two deadlines each time, leading to this eventful trip.

Despite the challenges, Indigo is determined to continue his journey despite the difficulties. He has secured a visa, a new SIM card, and awaits transportation to Cologne. He hopes to eventually reach his destination soon.

Today marks another milestone - officially entering Germany. He has arrived safely and is currently staying at a friend's apartment. His sister can act as a guardian if necessary. However, 0 is considered a special use case. It's also called a "space". 

On the iPhone 2, there is an empty key.

As I mentioned several months ago on Boing World, the estate offered us a garage space where we finally have somewhere we can store our van that we can convert into an RV (Micro Camper).
Therefore, I purchased this Berlingoo van last month.
Initially, I assumed that since it was already equipped with a ramp for people using wheelchairs, it might be easier to convert it into an RV. However, upon closer inspection, it turns out that the conversion process may not be straightforward due to various factors such as lowering the floor, lack of secure seating options, and limited storage areas beneath the vehicle.
Despite these challenges, the Berlingoo offers ample storage below the vehicle, making it suitable for long-term storage needs.
However, removing the metal plate covering the windows proved to be a mistake initially. Turns out, the metal plates were simply painted over with metallic paint instead of being removed altogether. Fortunately, scraping away the paint should suffice, although additional solvent-based treatments may be required depending on the condition of the paint.
In summary, while the Berlingoon van presents some obstacles during the conversion process, its storage capacity provides flexibility for longer term storage solutions. Nonetheless, the conversion process requires careful attention to detail to ensure optimal functionality once completed.

A nice evening to start drinking some Japanese Rum.
I have a little bottle of #Rhum from Japan called Cor Cor again - specifically the "Industriel" red variety made from molasses byproducts of sugar production instead of the green variety directly derived from cane juice fermentation.
It has a small bottle size. It's quite thick, has a heavy sugar aroma almost resembling probita, but not overly sweet. A dreamy daiquiris would be great if asked.
To add to this post on my #Japanease #Onomura #Rhum exploration,
I opened this OneRumbottle hoping to make a daiquiri but the scent or lack of prompted me to take another look at it. It smells a bit like palm toddy from India. It uses sugar from Ie Island. I'm tempted to call it a clairin-like drink but it's actually more like a spirit such as vodka or soju - thin, smoother with a slight kick (48% alcohol content).
The single island series is the only one available here except for the all island blended bottle. Here's their website where you can learn more about this rum:
https://oneru-mj-translate-goog/products/
Original link: https://onemr.com

- In Japanese, the number "nine" uses three letters instead of four like other languages.

T9 keyboards are confusing because they only allow certain combinations of letters instead of allowing them individually like regular keyboards. The reason 7 and * have four letters while other ones have three is because there's already enough room between each number pad so adding another character doesn't take much extra space. 

In terms of phone usage, 0 is often used as a space bar or separator rather than a separate digit. This makes sense since phones didn't originally have any digits beyond 9 before the advent of T9.

As for the iPhone 8+, it also lacks a "space" key due to its design choices. It uses a different layout where the numeric keypad is placed next to the alphanumeric keyboard which might be why it feels odd when using just the numeric buttons alone.

Regarding the +1 dialing code, it comes directly from the early days of the Bell system where they assigned specific codes to regions based on geography. They couldn't simply add a prefix to the area code since it would've made international calls impossible. Instead, they created unique codes for each region, making it easy to route calls within the country.

Finally, the letter Z was chosen over Y because it was considered too common and could easily lead to confusion during typing. The letter Y came later into play

Note: Major updates will begin with the thread emoji.

Last night was Horrible! Panic attacks, extreme fatigue, and nausea.

But look where I am! At the airport! I did it!

1. Finish professional resume (the most important!)

2. Find out how to get to private German language school (starts tomorrow, in-person).

3. Trip to apartment from hotel with backpack slowly bringing stuff over. I overloaded myself.

4. Eat out! Food! Get your mind out of the gutter! Lol

Even though I've mainly shifted to PC gaming within the past decade, my favored peripherals remain controllers.
I comprehend the benefits of KB+M gameplay, yet given that I utilize similar tools for work, I appreciate the convenience of a controller enabling me to distinguish between tasks and giving my arms a respite. I've also witnessed significant changes in video game technologies and layouts throughout my tenure, although certain initial-party controllers appear stagnant somewhat.
Recently, I discovered a controller that genuinely captivated me due to its impressively appealing attributes, necessitating lengthy discussion, however, I feel compelled to provide some background information; not a comprehensive history lesson, merely a stroll through my collection of controllers that accumulated over a lifetime of engaging in this hobby.
Ultimately, I hope you'll grasp why this subject holds significance to me, as I dedicate countless hours discussing these devices.
Apr 06, 2025, 9:35 PM Â· UTC

My decision to construct a personal computer game library began during the transition period between the Xbox 360 and the Xbox One; I deeply appreciated the Xbox 360, but the Xbox One appeared to be a disaster. Given the lack of interest among the major companies' consoles, I obtained a 360 PC adapter and decided to convert to the new platform.
Every single controller utilized extensively, and the Xbox 360 featured asymmetric stick placements that suited my preferences. Out of the controllers shown here, both the working ones are third-party Afterglow models (which possess their own issues).

Despite loving these controllers, the official ones suffered significantly regarding durability, and several were faulty upon launch, but Microsoft refused my Request for Return/Materialize Authorization (RMA).
Things worsened when I encountered the most expensive model.

During a time where I believed that paying more equates to higher quality products, I purchased the Elite Series 2 controller despite knowing that the previous iteration contained numerous flaws. That controller endured approximately a year until the stick drift became apparent, and the right bumper only responded half of the time. The dongle supplied with the device sucked, never functioning properly with any other controllers. Bluetooth latency was extremely poor, requiring the dongle to be employed frequently. In conjunction with all these factors, the rear paddles failed regardless of the software/driver configurations, rendering them ineffective across all games.

The Raikiri Pro (bundled with a laptop) serves as my current dedicated desktop controller and functions adequately [at present]. However, I will never invest another cent in official Xbox-branded controllers. F*ck Microsoft! I hope Xbox rotting away!

Nintendo Switch rejuvenated my passion for portable gaming after years of enduring out of outdated laptops. The Joy-Con controllers were petite yet versatile, whereas the Pro controller felt incredibly comfortable in hand.

These controllers were so beloved that I modded them and exchanged hall-effect sticks along with metal latch mechanisms this past year, while being aware of the drift problem, my controllers have remained flawless since 2017, exhibiting no sign of deterioration. I've spent as many hours into these controllers as I did with all those Xbox controllers; either I received exceptionally fortunate or Microsoft designed their controllers to fail quicker than both of their competitors combined. Nintendo's offerings have some shortcomings, but the inclusion of gyro input has been formally recognized.

I hope to maintain these controllers functioning for as long as possible on various platforms; there exist many alternatives, but these ones belong to me.

An aside note on PlayStation controllers to conclude the first-party lineup: I never liked them.

The DualShock 1-3 series felt identical to each other with identical faults: oversized thumbsticks positioned closely together, mushy face/button/trigger buttons that wore out rapidly, and a D-pad that simply felt incorrect. The DualShock 4 rectified many of the aforementioned issues, introducing a plethora of new ones. I acquired the DualSense controller because some friends struggled with asymmetric thumbsticks, and for some reason retail outlets offered it for $20 cheaper than DS4 controllers.

While I don't actually employ this controller: Face buttons are spaced too far apart, my audio output defaults to the controller whenever it's plugged in, the bumpers are oddly tall, and I often press the touchpad unintentionally when attempting to hit menu/share.

They serve as guest controllers that have evolved considerably in terms of design, but for me they're a novelty at best.

8 BitDo was my first venture into high-quality third-party controllers. This original SN30 Pro (subsequent versions feature hall-effect sticks and do not adhere to the SNES color scheme) remains one of my favorites because holding it evokes memories of my first console, the SNES.

Should I experience a bad day and require a nostalgic escape, this is the first controller I reach for. It possesses all the functionalities of a Switch Pro controller, but condensed into a modernized rendition of the SNES controller, featuring concave XY axes plus convex AB buttons, and potentially the best D-pad I've ever used. It has some minor issues, but it's consistently a source of comfort.

On occasion, the sticks may fail, or the battery might drain for the final time; however, should it mean acquiring one of the modern versions equipped with hall-effect sticks and swapping them, I'll do so once the opportunity arises.

Given such connectivity, surely 8 BitDo cannot do better than this, right?

Well... 

When I desire a contemporary representation of the SN30 Pro but with all the features of a modern controller, the 8 BitDo Pro 2 has become my go-to multiplatform controller.

All aspects of this product are a functional improvement from the SN30 Pro: more comfortable grips, hall-effect sticks, analog triggers, programmable back paddles, a physical X/D/S/A toggle switch, and a slightly easier-replaceable battery compared to AA batteries. Additionally, I also bought the carrying case and the mobile phone holder, which aren't seen as much usage with a smartphone (I distrust its grip); however, for smaller retro-emulation handhelds, it expands the range of playable games including those needing precise analog control.

Very few negative points can be said about this controller, but it ranks second amongst my collection. I'll speak about my favorite selection later, but before that, I must discuss...

Is it difficult to locate a modernized N64 controller?

Numerous low-cost imitations of the N64 controller abound, but the original trident-shaped design was an objective failure. I could enjoy N64 games with a modern controller utilizing clever configuration to emulate the face buttons as C-buttons, but it's not equivalent for myriad reasons.

I procured the RetroFights Brawler 64 to resolve this anachronic quandary, and it exceeded my expectations. It was crafted to replicate the official NSO N64 controller down to the point where the Steam recognizes it as one, with a toggle button making it recognize as a Pro controller without the right stick.

It contains some problems, but between its layout and compatibility, it solves more problems than the official version has. It's ideal for showcasing N64 emulations without intimidating the original or the anachronism from fiddling around with a modern controller to work the same.

It's excellent at what it aims to accomplish.

I acquired this Steam Controller from a pawn shop after negotiating the cost down shortly after the sale ended on Steam. It required some attention, and I did everything I could to ensure it operated smoothly again.

This remains one of the most customizable controllers in my collection, with a distinctive design and features that predate its time (gyroscope aiming, back paddles, haptic feedback, etc.). It has some problems though; It requires AAA batteries, utilizes micro USB for wired connections, sometimes turns itself back on after being turned off, the back paddles are stiff enough to cause discomfort, the thumbstick cap needs replacement since the rubber on it is deteriorating, and its functionality varies with updates to Steam input.

It's more of a historical artifact than a regular input, but it's a pleasant addition and enjoyable to tamper with on rainy days.

Additionally, it isn't my second-favorite controller, that honor belongs to...

The 8 BitDo Ultimate Bluetooth controller is an almost-perfect controller.

Hall-effect sticks, a built-in charging dock that doubles as a port for the included dongle, a dual-frequency/bluetooth toggle switch, NS Pro layout with a superior D-pad, analog triggers, and programmable back paddles. When I sit down on a couch with this controller, I can swap between a Steam Deck and a Switch faster than the time it takes the TV to switch inputs.

However, it has some drawbacks though: It only supports X/Switch signals (not Android or Apple modes), the triggers are uncomfortable, and input lag appears to be influenced by the duration it took to connect to the dongle/switch.

Thoughtfully, I expected this to be the best it could get, but like my experiences with Xbox controllers, I assumed that starting anew would shake my assumption. What I hoped to upgrade it to was such a disappointment that it quickly shattered my belief.

What I wanted to achieve was:

The tweet reads:

"Just fell down a doritos rabbit hole."

It mentions falling into a Doritos Rabbit Hole, picking up a Doritos bag from CVS pharmacy, eating it while feeling hungry after working on a computer screen, passing by a snack aisle, and noticing a black Doritos bag with a neon aesthetic featuring the words "Doritos: Late Night" and "Loaded Taco." The author also notes that several other late-night flavored Doritos exist besides the "Late Night" flavor mentioned in the tweet itself. They mention trying to find more information about the Doritos Late Night line, including visiting a Doritos After Dark concept restaurant called Crypto Stadium. The author concludes that the Doritos AfterDark concept is unrelated to the DoritosLateNight line and that the Doritostarbucks concept is not related either. The author expresses concern over the lack of variety among American fast-food options compared to European countries such as Italy, where people can enjoy diverse and unique dishes.

The tweet reads:

"Just fell down a doritos rabbit hole."

It was posted by Name1 from user1@shrike.club on March 6, 2025, at 00:18 UTC + Yuito. The username is 35 stars.

Thread:

Name1 @user1
Indigo's journey towards a new life!
Note: Major updates will begin with the thread emojis.
I'm planning to relocate to Germany and seek a new life. Follow along with this thread to track this journey.
The past three days or so were absolutely terrible! Panic attacks, extreme fatigue and nausea.
But look at where I currently am! At the airport! I managed to do it despite the circumstances.
I pushed myself excessively and ended up unable to sleep for thirty-two hours straight. As of now (right now), I am on my thirtysomething hour mark. Looking back on this, it seems like the only way it happened. ADHD is considered a Tanzanian trait.
Edit: tazmania.
In the last three months, I've accomplished quite a bit! I thought I might only take a month, but underestimated everything immensely. I re-booked the flight two times, but with two deadlines, this airplane is it!
Oh gosh... I met with a real estate agent, packed almost half of our belongings, gave away a third of my possessions, and the appropriate people have access to remaining items. My sister can act as a guardian if necessary. Seven or eight documents have been apostilled, degrees recognized

Game 9 of #UniveristyChallenge was a terrible match. Oxford University (530 students) versus Durham (20,000), and Oxford won, which surprised me after making some mistakes. The captain did not know Wittengsteinâ€™s name? Possibly just nervousness. Durham was ahead, then it was tied at 170, then they dropped to 165. A pity. I was rooting for them. Great team, with all four strong, so I hope they make the cut.

Game 10 of #UniveristyChallenge had a great performance by Christâ€™s Cambridge, who has a consultative captain, a good team, and a strong member named Bethlehem, so Roger Tilling called out â€œChristâ€™s Bethlehem!â€ Exeter Oxford never got hold of much, and are out of the running. I can see Christâ€™s Cambridge quietly going far in this series. 

Some nice math problems, a picture round related to food, and a tricky flag question. Good game.

Game 11 of #UniveristyChallenge was St Andrews (granted university status by an anti-pope!) versus Cardiff. Round one is near completion. Some good questions, including references to roll-on roll-off ferries, Agnes Martin, and Stax Records. Cardiff Tarsala will never forget her Booker T bloomer, Iâ€™m afraid. Nice quizbing from both teams, though it only really got crackinâ€™ in the last few minutes.

Game 12 of #UniveristyChallenge was Leeds versus Edinburgh. Leeds took a long time to get going, then had a surge in the middle but couldnâ€™t keep it going. Seems like a number of film questions this time, and I was glad to hear PEI as an answer; no flags, though it seems like they crop up every time. Edinburgh Myles is a good captain and the whole team is strong and works well together. I think theyâ€™ll do well.

Game 13 of #UniveristyChallenge was a curious one, with Leicester being jokey, wasting time and never getting going, while the LSE captain would often turn to the furthest player for an answer, which was not frequently wrong. Still, LSE cleaned up. I liked the blues bonus round, though sadly Leicester got none. Canadian mentions: WL Mackenzie King and Margaret Atwood. The best part was Roger Tilling saying â€œLeicester Lister!â€

Game 14 of #UniveristyChallenge was top-notch stuff, solid quizbing, down to business, fast answers, good knowledge, close ending. It seems weâ€™ll see both SOAS London and St. Edmund Hall Oxford again, because the loser makes the repechage. Very close at the finish, down to â€œNaplesâ€ and â€œpollen.â€ An unassumingly great game.

Game 15 of #UniveristyChallenge is the first of two in the repechage, where the four highest scoring losing teams try to make it through. This week was UCL and St. Andrews, in a good-natured cheery match. Very strong play from UCL, who have a solid team, and UCL Mandel was in top form. Good questions, some tough, such as requiring â€œpantheraâ€ specifically or knowing â€œdayâ€ in Russian.

Just got to game 16 of #UniveristyChallenge today, a week late, and it was a nail-biter! Really fast work at the end, with Durham coming from behind in the last few minutes to catch SOAS London in a tie in the final seconds. It went to a starter question that I got on the first clue (being an SF reader I knew â€œslipstreamâ€) but neither team knew. Second question and SOAS London Lambert guessed alpaca but it was llama, so Durham won. Phew, what a finish. ğŸ˜±

Game 17 of #UniveristyChallenge is the first of eight knockout games in the second round. This was UCL and LSE, and UCL gave an outstanding performance: very fast buzzing, good teamwork, wide general knowledge from them all (UCL Mandel notable again); they took off at the start and never slowed. Very impressive.

Game 18 of #UniveristyChallenge was Durham versus Open University. I was rooting for Durham, who have a great team, but in the end to my surprise Open took it, after a number of rather slow answers. I was glad Durham got Marcel Duchamp right on one question; too bad no one knew Yoko Ono as a Fluxus artist. Much respect for Durham Nash, especially on bird silhouettes and flags.

Game 19 of #UniveristyChallenge was Exeter versus Bristol. Bristol got going at the start and never looked back, rolling with momentum, finishing with an incredible score. Exeter only clawed their way back to 0 after 17 minutes. I liked the question on common terms in Chinese place names, such as åŒ— (beijing) in Beijing etc. Good geographic knowledge shown.

#UniveristyChallenge is back from the Christmas alumni series, and game 20 was liked greased lightning compared to previous rounds. Darwin Cambridge Whitaker tore into questions like a monster, but everyone was in good form on that team and also on Edinburgh. Momentum changed throughout the game. Good quizbing. Three more games in round two, then the long quarter finals.

Itâ€™s quite a change to go from the Christmas series of #UniveristyChallenge, where four people didnâ€™t know the name of the narrator of Moby-Dick even when told his name is in the first sentence of the book, to the regular round, where theyâ€™re racing to buzz on questions like â€œfifty-three british thermal units is to grouse hunting as sydney australia is to what famous star of the london stage?â€

Game 21 of #UniveristyChallenge was Wadham Oxford versus Imperial. What a game! Astounding performance from Imperial.

However, being King Crimson fan, I was disappointed that no one recognized them from the opening of â€œtwenty-first century schizoid man,â€ and dismayed when someone thought â€œI zimbraâ€ by talking heads (with fripp on guitar) was by the bee gees. Canâ€™t have it all. I remain incredibly impressed.

Game 22 of #UniveristyChallenge was Christâ€™s Cambridge versus St Edmund Hall Oxford, two small colleges, but thatâ€™s how the rules are set up. Nice picture round with the dunning-kruger effect, asch conformity experiments, and bouba-kiki effect. Another on mushrooms, which seemed tough to me; identifying them by eye is not easy. Solid game, good playing all around.

#universitychallenge game 23 was cardiff against queenâ€™s Belfast. ended with a lower score than i felt it would get, maybe due to missed bonuses, but the starters were buzzed fast. Nice flag knowledge, and a good picture round identifying physical laws by diagrams of experiments. A bit too much bantz for my taste, but a solid game. One more before the quarterfinals.

Therefore, I purchased this Berlingoo van last month. 
I assumed that since it was originally converted into a Van, it might make the conversion process easier. However, turns out that isnâ€™t necessarily true.
